sentences.english: He loves human being but he never marries or has any children.
sentences.chinese: 他热爱人类，却从未受过拥有妻室与子女的天伦之乐。

sentences.english: We basked in the love of our family.
sentences.chinese: 我们享受着融融的天伦之乐。

sentences.english: His wife and children parents together the happiness of a family union, and friend wine lotus word poetry.
sentences.chinese: 与妻儿父母齐天伦之乐，与朋友友把酒忘忧言诗词。

sentences.english: That old man is basking in the love of his family.
sentences.chinese: 那位老人家正享受着融融的天伦之乐。

sentences.english: Sometimes, Betty and I and other members of the family spend a nice weekend together at Fanling Lodge.
sentences.chinese: 一家人有时会到粉岭别墅度周末，共享天伦之乐。

sentences.english: Rich or poor, we will keep together and be happy in one another.
sentences.chinese: 不论贫富，我们都要厮守一起，共享天伦之乐。

definition: lit. to play with one's grandchildren while eating candy (idiom)/fig. to enjoy a happy and leisurely old age
(children) run around parent's knees/fig. to stay to look after one's elderly parents
lit. to nurture one's years (idiom)/fig. to enjoy one's later years
lit. the happy fate of the man from Qi (who had a wife and a concubine) (idiom)/fig. (ironically) the joy of having several partners/the life of a pasha
world with only two people (usually refers to a romantic couple)/romantic couple's world
benevolent father, filial son (idiom)/natural love between parents and children
to live comfortably/happy and prosperous life
